page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This is an area of undulating landscape and gentle slopes.It straddles an area of higher ground between the industrial areas of the West Midlands and the more agricultural areas of Warwickshire and Leicestershire.The whole of the area is in Warwickshire. A number of small streams begin life in springs just below the summits of the higher areas of land at about 450 metres above sea level.These have produced gently sloping valleys. It is on the edge of the Warickshire Coalfield and there were two mines which have now closed leaving areas of derelict land. Three villages grew,Ansley,Ansley Common and Galley Common.Most of the area is in the Parish of Ansley,which was mentioned in the Domesday Book.
